name: Rep. Ted Lieu
tweet_text:
"I hope you will come together and make absolutely clear how we, as a Congress and as nation, feel about what President Trump did by convicting him.

It is what our Constitution requires.  And it is what our country deserves."

name: Rep. Ted Lieu
tweet_text: "Impeachment, conviction and disqualification is not just about the past, it‚Äôs about the future.  It‚Äôs about making sure that no future official, no future president, does what President Trump did."

name: Rep. Ted Lieu
tweet_text:
"No one is here saying that President Trump cannot contest the election.

But what Trump did, as his former chief of staff explained, was different.  It was dishonorable. It was un-American. And it resulted in fatalities. "

name: Rep. Ted Lieu
tweet_text: "People in his own party, governors, former officials, current officials, and members of Congress have unambiguously and passionately said that what President Trump did was 'disgraceful' and 'shameful.'"

name: Rep. Ted Lieu
tweet_text:
"Now, Pres. Trump would have his base, & the world, believe that his conduct was totally appropriate. 

It is important to impeach that falsehood‚Äîto make clear to his supporters, & everyone watching, that what President Trump did was not acceptable. In fact, quite the opposite."

name: Rep. Ted Lieu
tweet_text: "If you or I make a mistake, and something very bad happens, we would show remorse. We would accept responsibility. But President Trump didn't do any of that. Why not? Because he intended for the events of January 6 to happen. How do we know? He told us."

name: Rep. Ted Lieu
tweet_text: "President Trump not only has failed to show remorse, or take accountability, he has made clear that he is just beginning."

name: Rep. Ted Lieu
tweet_text: "We have to hold Trump accountable. To send the message that it is never patriotic to incite a violent attack against our nation's Capitol. And that future Presidents will know that they can't follow in Donald Trump's footsteps and get away with it."

name: Rep. Ted Lieu
tweet_text: The President has broad authority to remedy injustice & provide mercy through the issuance of pardons and commutations. Yet thousands of nonviolent offenders, a disproportionate number are people of color, are serving harsh prison terms as a result of the so-called War on Drugs.

name: Rep. Ted Lieu
tweet_text: Presidential pardons and commutations should not be viewed as an occasionally act of forgiveness but treated as a routine part of the federal criminal justice system to remedy injustice and provide mercy.

name: Rep. Ted Lieu
tweet_text: In February, Trump granted clemency to 11 people, including several individuals who had been convicted on charges related to political corruption, like former Celebrity Apprentice contestant Rod Blagojevich.

name: Rep. Ted Lieu
tweet_text: Americans shouldn't need a celebrity advocating on their behalf to get a pardon from the president. Under Trump, thousands of petitions are ignored while those with special access to the president are granted clemency.
